paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant V142I, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Notably, the individual with a prior diagnosis of hATTR was the only EA individual to receive a TTR result and the only individual not harboring V142I.
Three of 34 (8.8%) TTR results were disclosed with a third-party Spanish interpreter to participants whose preferred language was Spanish.

functional_data.summary: The V142I variant is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis, particularly in African ancestry populations.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families, as indicated by the affected status of some carriers.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical significance and population studies.
variants.additional_notes: The study highlights the importance of including TTR in genomic screening programs for diverse populations.
key_quotes: The addition of TTR to a pilot genomic screening program meant that we returned results to a higher proportion of AA and HL participants.
Three of 34 (8.8%) TTR results were disclosed with a third-party Spanish interpreter to participants whose preferred language was Spanish.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text, focusing on the TTR gene.
